required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Dose Escalation Study of Proton and Carbon Ion Irradiation for HER2 Positive and Triple Negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose Escalation Study of Proton and Carbon Ion Irradiation for HER2 Positive and Triple Negative Breast Cancer After Breast Conserving Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

brief_summary.textblock:
Adjuvant radiotherapy is the standard treatment for early breast cancer after breast conserving surgery. Molecular subtypes was significantly associated with the risk of local recurrence of breast cancer. Nguyen et al found that the overall 5-year cumulative incidence of local recurrence was 0.8% for luminal A, 1.5% for luminal B, 8.4% for HER2 positive, and 7.1% for triple negative breast cancer after lumpectomy and radiotherapy. Her2 positive and triple negative breast cancers may be inherently radioresistant.
Therefore, for HER2 positive and triple negative breast cancer with high local recurrence and radiation resistance, proton combined with carbon ion is proposed after breast conserving surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after the completion of CIRT
primary_outcome.description: Treatment related acute toxicity assessed by CTCAE v4.03

secondary_outcome.description: The Ipsilateral breast and regional lymph nodes recurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Cosmetic outcome as measured by Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Cosmetic outcome will be evaluated by Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale filled out by patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cosmetic outcome as measured by BCCT.core software
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' photographs of the breasts will be taken. With the use of BCCT.core software from The Breast Research group (INESC TEC) cosmetic outcome will be assessed.

arm_group.description: CTV1: whole breast, proton therapy. CTVboost: Tumor bed, carbon ion dose escalation study with four dose levels.

intervention.description: CTV1: whole breast, 40.05Gy(RBE) in 15 fractions with proton ion therapy; CTVboost: Tumor bed, carbon ion dose escalation study with four dose levels [10.2Gy(RBE)/3Fx,10.8Gy(RBE) /3Fx,11.4Gy(RBE)/3Fx and 12Gy(RBE)/3Fx ].

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed HER2 positive or Triple Negative invasive breast carcinoma.(HER2 positive: immunohistochemistry [IHC] 3+ and or fluorescence in situ hybridization [FISH] amplified; Triple Negative: estrogen receptor [ER] and progesterone receptor [PR] < 1%, HER2 negative [IHC 1+ or 2+ FISH non-amplified])
- Age ≥ 18 years and ≤ 80 years.
- The primary tumor must be excised via breast conserving surgery.
- Stage p T1-2 N0 M0
- ECOG performance status ≤2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Invasive breast cancer not confirmed by pathology.
- Distant metastasis
- Prior thoracic radiation.
- Pregnancy or lactating.

facility.name: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center
